channel.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
channel.description: So I thought we could discuss this middle eastern bloodbath. I'll start the debate by saying that Israel should never have existed in the first place given the conditions of it's foundations- and that a great many territories should be Arab (Due to history and demographics, for instance- upon partition in 1948 the Jewish settlers owned less than a tenth of the land in Palestine- but were given 56% by the UN). Israel ensued illegal annexations in following wars. (Though now it's to late to completely revert. Hamas though is as bad an entity, and both sides seem to have total disregard for civilian loss of life. I also think our tax money shouldn't be spent on supporting such a state. There is no reason why Jews and Arab-Muslims can't coexist peacefully in a same secular state, Zionism and to an extent the Islamist are to blame for the ongoing fighting.

so a 18 years old kid with a “free to kill” license is considered a civilian ?

on a side note, I don’t think a person who reached 18 years old is still a kid does he ?

let my try to explain, when an enemy invades a Muslim land no matter how far this land is, he is considered an enemy to whole Muslims and we should rush and defend it against it, and no bro it’s a major sin to kill Jewish “children, women, and the old” only the soldiers

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Shadi
item.description:
mattemuse:

It doesn’t matter if you “question” it, the law exists, and international law has to be the basis for third party negotiations or else the solution will never be seen as legitimate by the international community.

That’s ridiculous. Our token forum Muslim, Shadi, is from JORDAN, and he openly says its ok to kill Jewish kids that are conscripted into the Israeli army because of Gaza.

woah man ! where did I say that it’s ok to kill Jewish kids ?

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Lets take another Muslim in our world, say the CIA asset who turned double agent and blew himself up in Afghanistan. Also a Jordanian, incidentally. What made him switch from helping the CIA fight A-Q in Afghanistan to bombing them? People who know him say Gaza and civilian casualties from drone airstrikes in Pakistan.

I never said Israel was the “driving force behind Mideast violence” and “solving the provlem will make the world a happy place.” Try debating what I actually posted, if you want a discussion.
.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
So a Muslim on our forums says something and then that is what everyone thinks. Lets take another Muslim in our world, say the president of Iran (don’t make me spell it). He says he wants to wipe Israel of the map. One person on the internet is hardly enough to justify a claim that Israel is the driving force behind Mideast violence, and that the solving of that problem will make the world a happy place.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Which I question. If someone goes to war against a nation, and that nation wins any land they claimed belongs to them.

It doesn’t matter if you “question” it, the law exists, and international law has to be the basis for third party negotiations or else the solution will never be seen as legitimate by the international community.

Someonerandm:

Also, to counter a previous point, terrorist recruiting would be hurt among Palestinians, but elsewhere in the mideast there would be no difference, and Israel would remain an enemy if only because it has close ties to the US.

That’s ridiculous. Our token forum Muslim, Shadi, is from JORDAN, and he openly says its ok to kill Jewish kids that are conscripted into the Israeli army because of Gaza.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Which I question. If someone goes to war against a nation, and that nation wins (yes, Israel attacked first, that doesn’t mean they started it), then any land they claimed belongs to them. But that is a debate for elsewhere.
Also, to counter a previous point, terrorist recruiting would be hurt among Palestinians, but elsewhere in the mideast there would be no difference, and Israel would remain an enemy if only because it has close ties to the US.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Funny that you put “illegal” in quotes - in fact it is explicitly illegal to take territory by war under international law.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Fruit:

Actually, Israel has illegally annexed some land near the West Bank border. It’s mostly occupied by extremists who believe that the West Bank belongs to Israel though. But it is true that the land that they have now was won in wars, which they defended several times. They also used to control the whole of the Sinai peninsula for a while.

My Global Studies class just finished a unit on this conflict.
:S

That land can be given back. I’m talking about the land that Israel gained in wars, that many Palestinians believe to be theirs.

Read full topic

item.description:
Can I go to my Grandmother’s old house and tell the people living there now to get off my land since I lived there before and God told me it was mine? Sweet!

or

Nuke everyone. Problem solved.

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Fruit
item.description:
Someonerandm:

All that needs to be done is set a definite border for Israel, which may include the supposedly “illegal” land they won in a war against religious idiots, and that is their land. If they win further land in wars they are provoked into entering, then that is their land as well.

Actually, Israel has illegally annexed some land near the West Bank border. It’s mostly occupied by extremists who believe that the West Bank belongs to Israel though. But it is true that the land that they have now was won in wars, which they defended several times. They also used to control the whole of the Sinai peninsula for a while.

My Global Studies class just finished a unit on this conflict.
:S

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
i think US aid should be pulled though. 60 years of military freebies is enough now. It’s not like Israel doesn’t have the funds to fight their own wars. the US as well as germany and other western countries should cut off their aid.

It’s also a little unrealistic to think that this problem will be solved so simply, these religious factions have been at war over their holy soil since their inceptions. Both sides seem to be doing what ever it takes to win, with no regard for human rights or civilian casualties. In turn, both religions are violating their creeds. In Islam, it is said that if you kill one Innocent, it’s like killing the whole world. In Judaism, God through Moses clearly states that murder is wrong. Ultimatally, we should have no part in their blood feud.

Maybe after a year of Foreign Aid cut-off, then the US, along with the UN can try to negotiate with both parties, but right now, peace talks only delay inevitable wars.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Someonerandm:

But do you really trust their word?

Thats the definition of negotiating in good faith.

Someonerandm:

And not only that, even if they stop, Israel will attract terrorists from all over the Mideast.

The existence of an autonomous Palestinian state would be the most powerful blow to terrorist recruitment in recent history. Israel’s occupation of Gaza/Palestine is one of the most significant factors in radicalizing Muslims. Even our own mild-mannered forum Muslim, Shadi, says that good Muslims should fight against Israel because of Gaza.

Someonerandm:

Ultimately, Israel will be at peace when the mideast is at peace, and no action they will do can cause mid-east peace.

We disagree, I believe if they stop the seige of Gaza and halt expansion into the occupied territories, that’s the first step towards comprehensive mideast peace.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
But do you really trust their word? And not only that, even if they stop, Israel will attract terrorists from all over the Mideast. Ultimately, Israel will be at peace when the mideast is at peace, and no action they will do can cause mid-east peace.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
I question whether Hamas “would not stop until Israel is destroyed.” In fact their leadership has declared that they will recognize Israel if it withdraws to the '67 borders.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
I question whether returning the Palestinian’s land would bring even temporary peace. Groups like Hamas would not stop until Israel is destroyed, and they have a wide influence, and Israel’s close proximity to their bases of operation would mean that massive terrorist attacks would be much easier. Israel would just find itself fighting another, possibly more costly, war.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Its the first step in solving the problem. You’re right that it’s an unwinnable war for either side, it’s only going to be solved by peaceful negotiation of an autonomous palestinian state brokered through third parties, and with heavy pressure on Israel from the US with our military aid on the line.

Ultimately I think Israel/Palestine are going to have a Berlin Wall moment, and as an ethnic Jew I sincerely hope that the proverbial wall comes down after at least a decade of peaceful coexistance, rather than after another decade of this eye-for-an-eye violence.

Read full topic

item.title: Zionism Palestinian-Israeli conflict
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
While I agree to an extent, that will by no means solve the problem. Ultimately this is an unwinable war, unless we see mass genocide of 7.5 million+ people.

Read full topic
